parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From epi and strepho; to revert.
(primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From epi and strepho; to revert.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Golden, made of gold, adorned with gold. From chrusos; made of gold.
A lamp-stand. From luchnos; a lamp-stand.
